column4: ok, networking question time. I've been trying to get my Atheros AR5212 chipset wireless card to see my wpa-psk network for a while now. So far, I've got the MadWiFI driver on, the WPA Supplicant on. I am trying to get the network-manager-gnome on, but (and this is going to sound like a dumb question) I can't seem to install it using 'sudo apt-get install network-manager-gnome' from inside the extracted directory. What am I doing wrong?
I'm using Edgy 6.10 by the way, if that helps...
aptitude search network-manager-gnome
just done the aptitude search. drive ticked but then got another command prompt up. now what?
sudo aptitude update
and then?
aptitude search network-manager-gnome
see the package now?
pastebin your sources.lst?
then aptitude ain't gonna help you at all
is there a way to manually install it?
aptitude/apt-get/Synaptic/Adept are all package managers. you can't search for and download and install a package to a machine with no network connection.
sure, download n-m-g and all its dependencies and install them by hand
- sorry to be a pain about this. VERY new to linux
you don't. here's a list of n-m-g dependencies.
feel free to get *all* those dependencies. or to just put a NIC in that machine for 10 minutes. ;)
this machine has no wired connection?
pull ih downstairs long enough to do the wireless dance?
don't *think* there is enough power sockets downstairs...
looks like i don't have a choice though, really...
ok, what are the commands i need to perform on the box downstairs
or just set the router to do WEP for 10 minutes
